skill.name: building-native-ui
skill.description: Complete guide for building beautiful apps with Expo Router. Covers fundamentals, styling, components, navigation, animations, patterns, and native tabs.
skill.summary: Build beautiful native iOS apps with Expo Router. Covers UI components, navigation, animations, and platform-specific patterns.
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: All 614 static findings are false positives. This is legitimate Expo documentation containing code examples for building native iOS apps. The scanner incorrectly flagged documentation patterns including CLI command examples (npx expo), CSS color values (rgba), and regex patterns as security issues. No malicious code present.

medium_findings.title: Documentation Code Examples Misidentified as Shell Commands
medium_findings.description: The static scanner flagged 547 instances of 'Ruby/shell backtick execution' in markdown files. These are legitimate code examples showing CLI commands like `npx expo start` and `npx expo run:ios` in documentation. The backticks are markdown code formatting, not shell execution.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Backticks in markdown denote inline code formatting. The content describes Expo CLI commands for development workflows, not shell execution.

medium_findings.title: CSS Color Values Misidentified as Cryptographic Patterns
medium_findings.description: The scanner flagged 'weak cryptographic algorithm' on CSS color values like `rgba(0, 0, 0, 0.05)` and regex patterns like `match(/\((.*)\)/)`. These are standard CSS and JavaScript patterns for styling and string parsing, not cryptographic operations.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: RGBA color values are CSS syntax for transparent colors. The regex extracts route segments for navigation logic, unrelated to cryptography.

medium_findings.title: Storage API Documentation Misidentified as Security Risk
medium_findings.description: The scanner flagged references to AsyncStorage, SecureStore, and SQLite as 'sensitive data access'. These are legitimate Expo storage APIs being documented for app data persistence patterns.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: The skill documents Expo's official storage APIs for persistence, a standard requirement for mobile app development.

medium_findings.title: Template Injection Heuristic False Positive
medium_findings.description: The scanner flagged line 32 as 'template injection targeting system prompt'. This line reads: 'Start with Expo Go: Run `npx expo start` and scan the QR code with Expo Go' - pure documentation text.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: This is plain text documentation describing the Expo Go development workflow. No template injection mechanism exists.

medium_findings.title: Heuristic Alert Triggered by Documentation Patterns
medium_findings.description: Critical heuristic alerts flagged 'dangerous combination: code execution + network + credential access'. These patterns co-occur because the documentation covers complete app development including networking (expo-camera, expo-media-library) and storage (SecureStore) - standard mobile app patterns.
medium_findings.confidence_reasoning: Mobile app development legitimately requires networking, storage, and command-line tooling. Documentation covering these topics triggers pattern-based heuristics incorrectly.

low_findings.title: Environment Variable Reference Documentation
low_findings.description: Line 81 documents `process.env.EXPO_OS` for platform detection. This is the recommended Expo pattern for environment-aware rendering.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: EXPO_OS is an official Expo environment variable. Documenting its use is appropriate for a UI guidelines skill.

low_findings.title: Hardcoded URL References in Documentation
low_findings.description: URLs like documentation links and API endpoints appear in the documentation. These are reference examples, not external network calls.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Static documentation URLs are harmless. No network calls are made by the skill itself.

content.user_title: Build Native iOS UI with Expo Router
content.value_statement: Building iOS apps requires understanding native components, platform conventions, and Expo Router patterns. This skill provides comprehensive guidelines for creating polished, Apple-compliant interfaces using modern Expo patterns.
actual_capabilities: Creates iOS-native tab navigation using NativeTabs with SF Symbols icons
Implements platform-specific UI patterns following Apple Human Interface Guidelines
Adds smooth animations with Reanimated including enter/exit and scroll-driven effects
Builds search integration with headerSearchBarOptions and useSearch hook
Configures native iOS controls like Switch, Slider, SegmentedControl, and DateTimePicker
Implements visual effects with expo-blur, liquid glass, and custom shadows
limitations: Does not generate Android-specific UI patterns or Material Design components
Does not cover custom native module development outside Expo ecosystem
Does not provide backend API implementation or database schema design
Does not include accessibility audit or WCAG compliance verification

use_cases.title: Create iOS-native tab navigation
use_cases.description: Build polished iOS apps with NativeTabs, SF Symbols icons, and proper iOS 26 tab bar features like liquid glass backgrounds.
use_cases.target_user: iOS developers building Expo apps who need platform-native navigation patterns

use_cases.title: Add smooth animations and gestures
use_cases.description: Implement entering, exiting, layout, and scroll-driven animations with Reanimated for polished user experiences.
use_cases.target_user: Frontend developers adding motion design to React Native applications

use_cases.title: Integrate native iOS controls
use_cases.description: Add Switch, Slider, SegmentedControl, DateTimePicker, and other iOS-native form controls with proper platform styling.
use_cases.target_user: Mobile developers building form interfaces requiring platform-specific components

prompt_templates.title: Create native tab navigation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a new Expo Router app with native iOS tab navigation using NativeTabs and SF Symbols icons. Include a (home, search, profile) tab structure with proper navigation stacks inside each tab. Use liquid glass background effects for the tab bar.
prompt_templates.scenario: Setting up a new Expo iOS app with proper tab navigation

prompt_templates.title: Add search bar to stack header
prompt_templates.prompt: Add a search bar to the stack header in my Expo Router app. Use headerSearchBarOptions with proper configuration. Include filtering patterns with the useSearch hook to filter a list of items based on user input.
prompt_templates.scenario: Implementing search functionality in navigation headers

prompt_templates.title: Create animated list with gestures
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a FlatList with entering and exiting animations using Reanimated. Add swipe-to-delete gestures with haptic feedback. Use contentInsetAdjustmentBehavior="automatic" for proper safe area handling.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building animated list interfaces with gesture interactions

prompt_templates.title: Build form sheet with native controls
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a modal presentation using formSheet presentation style. Include a native Switch component, Slider, and SegmentedControl. Add blur effect backdrop using expo-blur. Make the background liquid glass on iOS 26+.
prompt_templates.scenario: Building native iOS form interfaces with platform controls

output_examples.input: Create a tab layout with NativeTabs and icons
output: Creates NativeTabs with SF Symbols icons for each tab
Implements proper tab triggers with labels
Adds theme wrapper for consistent styling

output_examples.input: Add entering animation to screen transition
output: Implements SharedElement transition for smooth navigation
Uses useSearch hook for query state management

best_practices: Always use expo-symbols for icons and NativeTabs for iOS tab navigation to match platform conventions
Configure contentInsetAdjustmentBehavior="automatic" on ScrollView, FlatList, and SectionList for proper safe area handling
Add entering and exiting animations for all state changes to create polished user experiences
anti_patterns: Never use intrinsic HTML elements like div or img in Expo Router - these only work in web views
Never use legacy React Native components like Picker, WebView, or SafeAreaView - use expo alternatives
Never skip Expo Go testing before creating custom native builds - custom builds add complexity and slower iteration

faq.question: What is the difference between Expo Go and custom builds?
faq.answer: Expo Go is a sandbox that runs pre-built Expo apps instantly. Custom builds (npx expo run:ios/android) are full native projects needed only for local native modules, Apple targets, or third-party native libraries not in Expo Go.

faq.question: How do I add icons to NativeTabs?
faq.answer: Use expo-symbols package with SF Symbols. Import Icon from expo-router/unstable-native-tabs and use NativeTabs.Trigger with sf prop for SF Symbol names like 'list.dash' or 'magnifyingglass'.

faq.question: What animation library should I use?
faq.answer: Use Reanimated for all animations including entering, exiting, layout transitions, and scroll-driven animations. It runs animations on the UI thread for smooth 60fps performance.

faq.question: How do I implement search in Expo Router?
faq.answer: Use headerSearchBarOptions in Stack.Screen options for built-in search bar. Use the useSearch hook to manage query state. Filter your data based on the search query for real-time filtering.

faq.question: What controls are available for iOS?
faq.answer: Use native iOS controls from React Native and community packages: Switch, Slider, SegmentedControl, and DateTimePicker from @react-native-community/datetimepicker. Avoid legacy Picker component.

faq.question: How do I achieve iOS 26 liquid glass effects?
faq.answer: Use expo-glass-effect for liquid glass backdrops. Set contentStyle with backgroundColor: 'transparent' on Stack.Screen or Sheet options. Use expo-blur for blur effect overlays.
